item.title: Navigations
item.description: Detecting if a cross-site page triggered a navigation (or didn’t) can be useful to an attacker. For example, a website may trigger a navigation in a certain endpoint depending on the status of the user. To detect if any kind of navigation occurred, an attacker can: Use an iframe and count the number of times the onload event is triggered. Check the value of history.length, which is accessible through any window reference.

item.title: Download Bar
